metadata.title: 5226-1 -- systemd vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that systemd-tmpfiles employed uncontrolled recursion when removing deeply nested directory hierarchies. A local attacker could exploit this to cause systemd-tmpfiles to crash or have other unspecified impacts.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo ua fix USN-5226-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  systemd-tests - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 systemd-coredump - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 systemd - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 libsystemd0 - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 systemd-container - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 libnss-myhostname - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 libudev1 - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 systemd-timesyncd - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 libsystemd-dev - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 libnss-systemd - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 systemd-journal-remote - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 libpam-systemd - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 libnss-mymachines - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 libnss-resolve - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 systemd-sysv - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 udev - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 libudev-dev - 248.3-1ubuntu8.2 No subscription required
